intro: Caesia arcuata, commonly known as the curved beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Caesia arcuata is a perennial herb that blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
